definition: the act of deciding to do something, be in a state of action
details:
noun
- the act of deciding to do something
= example: the act of deciding to do something
- (game) a player's turn to take some action permitted by the rules of the game
- the act of changing your residence or place of business
= example: the act of changing your residence or place of business
= synonyms: relocation
- the act of changing location from one place to another
= synonyms: motion, movement
- a change of position that does not entail a change of location
= synonyms: motion, movement, motility
verb
- be in a state of action
- go or proceed from one point to another
= example: go or proceed from one point to another
- progress by being changed
= synonyms: go, run
- propose formally
= synonyms: make a motion
- have a turn
= example: have a turn
= synonyms: go
- give an incentive for action
= example: give an incentive for action
= synonyms: prompt, incite, propel, actuate, motivate
- have an emotional or cognitive impact upon
= synonyms: strike
- arouse sympathy or compassion in
= example: arouse sympathy or compassion in
- move so as to change position, perform a nontranslational motion
= example: move so as to change position, perform a nontranslational motion
- change location
= example: change location
= synonyms: travel, go, locomote
- cause to move or shift into a new position or place, both in a concrete and in an abstract sense
= synonyms: displace
- change residence, affiliation, or place of employment
= example: change residence, affiliation, or place of employment
- dispose of by selling
= example: dispose of by selling
= synonyms: de-access
- perform an action, or work out or perform (an action)
= synonyms: act
- follow a procedure or take a course
= synonyms: go, proceed
- live one's life in a specified environment
= example: live one's life in a specified environment
